Raw: Further , at an enthusiastic meeting at the Eustace Miles Restaurant on Thursday , January 13 , a strong resolution pledging the meeting to " sink all other political questions until women are given the Parliamentary vote " was passed unanimously , and the audience , most of whom were Liberals , agreed to use their votes and all their political pressure against Liberal candidates .
Description: A strong resolution pledging the meeting to sink all other political questions until women are given the Parliamentary vote was passed unanimously, and the audience, most of whom were Liberals, agreed to use their votes and all their political pressure against Liberal candidates.

Raw: On Monday next , January 24 , at the Queen's Hall , from 3 to 5 , Miss Christabel Pankhurst and Mrs. Pethick Lawrence will speak , and Miss Evelyn Sharp and Miss C. Margesson will give an account of their very successful election campaigns in N. Kensington and St. Pancras .
Speakers: ['Miss Christabel Pankhurst', 'Mrs. Pethick Lawrence', 'Miss Evelyn Sharp', 'Miss C. Margesson']

Raw: Those who find it more convenient to go to an evening meeting have their opportunities on Thursday even- ings at St. James's Hall , at 8 o'clock . Next Thursday Miss L. Tyson will speak on the election campaign in Streatham , Miss Haig on Chelsea , and Miss Bonwick on N. Islington .
The next great ticket meeting in London will take place in the Albert Hall on Friday , March 18 , and those wishing to be present should apply for tickets without delay .
Next Monday Mrs. Pankhurst will speak at Worksop
and on February 15 at Croydon .

Among other important public meetings arranged is oe at Edinburgh , when friends of the movement , as well as those anxious for further information about it , will have an opportunity of hearing Mrs. Pethick Lawrence in the Synod Hall . This is on Wednesday , Feb- ruary 24 .

The promoters of the Scottish Exhi- bition and Sale of Work which , as already announced , will be held in Glasgow on April 28 , 29 and 30 , will gladly wel- come gifts suitable for the various stalls .

Meanwhile the work is going on in the Assembly Rooms at Crouch End, where an address on "The Voteless Woman at Work" has been given, and on Feb- ruary 3 Miss Brackenbury will speak on " Tac- tics Up - to - Date . "

It is hoped that all men and women interested in the cause will attend the weekly meetings held on Tuesday evenings at 8 p.m. at 2 , Campden Hill Square .
To - day (Friday ) sees the commencement of a vigorous open - air campaign in Scotstown , end- ing up with an indoor meeting on the 29th.
Description: Indoor meeting as the final part of an open-air campaign

Raw: On Wednesday , the 12th , Mrs. Drummond spoke in the Abbey Church Hall to a very well attended meeting and quite won over the hecklers by the completeness of their own defeat.
On Thursday Mrs. Lawton made a superb speech to the Leith electors in Trafalgar Hall on the relation of the working man and woman.
Two dinner - hour and two evening meetings will be held every day in the Tyneside Division.
